items.title: Senate Democrats Investigate Kennedy Center Deals With Trump Allies
items.summary: Under Richard Grenell, the performing arts center has given steep discounts to CPAC and FIFA, signed contracts with administration associates and spent lavishly on friends.

items.title: Democrats Raise Concerns Over Allied Curbs on Intelligence Sharing
items.summary: Britain’s limits on sharing information reflect growing unease among partner nations over the legality of the U.S. strikes on boats purportedly carrying drugs.

items.title: Before Fatal UPS Plane Crash, Engine Brace Had Cracked, Safety Agency Says
items.summary: The cargo plane was taking off from Louisville earlier this month when it crashed moments after becoming airborne, killing the three crew members and 11 people on the ground.

items.title: MacKenzie Scott Expands Giving Spree to Tribal Colleges
items.summary: The billionaire philanthropist is steering millions of dollars toward tribal schools, after the Trump administration proposed a significant federal funding cut.

items.title: Lawsuit Challenges Trump Administration Over $1.8 Million in Immigration Fines
items.summary: A class-action suit accuses the Trump administration of weaponizing civil penalties to force undocumented migrants to self-deport through enormous penalties.

items.title: Trump Was Not Invited to Cheney’s Memorial Service
items.summary: Former Vice President Dick Cheney, a once-powerful Republican, turned on Mr. Trump last year by announcing he would vote for Vice President Kamala Harris.

items.title: US dignitaries go to Dick Cheney’s funeral but Trump, Obama and Clinton not in attendance – live
items.summary: <p>Donald Trump and JD Vance reportedly not invited to the former vice-president’s funeral; Clintons and Obamas notably absent from the event</p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/20/dick-cheney-funeral-trump-vance">Donald Trump and JD Vance snubbed for Dick Cheney’s funeral</a></p></li></ul><p>The <strong><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/trump-administration">Trump administration</a></strong> presented a new plan to roll back regulations in the <strong>Endangered Species Act (ESA)</strong> on Wednesday, a move experts fear will accelerate the extinction crisis if adopted.</p><p><a href="https://content.govdelivery.com/accounts/USDOI/bulletins/3fc00d6">The proposed</a><strong><a href="https://content.govdelivery.com/accounts/USDOI/bulletins/3fc00d6"> </a></strong><a href="https://content.govdelivery.com/accounts/USDOI/bulletins/3fc00d6">changes</a> would allow the federal government more power to weigh economic impact against habitat designations, remove safeguards against future events – including the impacts from the climate crisis – and rescind the “blanket rule” that automatically grants threatened species the same protections as those designated as endangered.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/nov/20/donald-trump-jeffrey-epstein-justice-department-zohran-mamdani-news-updates-us-politics-live">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: Donald Trump and JD Vance snubbed for Dick Cheney’s funeral
items.summary: <p>Joe Biden and George W Bush attend Republican’s service, while notable absences included Barack Obama and Bill Clinton</p><p>Donald Trump and JD Vance have been snubbed, by not being invited to former vice-president Dick Cheney’s funeral, taking place on Thursday, according to a White House official familiar with the matter.</p><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/dick-cheney">Cheney</a>, the former US vice-president to George W Bush and Republican defense hawk who became a fierce critic of the current US president, died earlier this month at the age of 84.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/20/dick-cheney-funeral-trump-vance">Continue reading...</a>
